video.title: Lords of War
video.synopsis: Follow Sean Rich and his team of experts as they traverse the United States searching for antique weapons, from swords and axes to guns and cannons.

episodes.synopsis: A 17th-century bronze cannon has host Sean Rich so fired up, he makes an unusual move, offering the seller $8,000 on the spot.
episodes.title: I Love Cannons

episodes.synopsis: Sean helps a young man get out of debt by auctioning off a 500-year-old gun that might have been designed by Leonardo da Vinci.
episodes.title: Da Vinci's Killer Pistol

episodes.synopsis: Sean fires off an 18th-century blunderbuss that was used on ships during the American Revolution.
episodes.title: Blunderbuss Blowout

episodes.synopsis: In Colorado, the guys fire a MAC-10 submachine gun and a Civil War Enfield rifle and examine a 76-pound bar of silver.
episodes.title: Sunken Treasure

episodes.synopsis: In Colorado Springs, the Lords of War come across a World War II searchlight that could sell for $40,000.
episodes.title: The Secret Flame

episodes.synopsis: A Korean War veteran brings in an M1 Carbine that could be worth $1,500 -- pocket change compared to two 18th-century dueling pistols worth $6,000.
episodes.title: Duel to the Death

episodes.synopsis: The guys find a German MG-42 machine gun from World War II -- known as "Hitler's Buzzsaw" -- that fired 1,200 to 1,500 rounds per minute.
episodes.title: Hitler's Buzzsaw

episodes.synopsis: One seller, disappointed to learn that his Japanese sword was not actually "Made in Japan," is in for a surprise.
episodes.title: Pirate's Deadly Pistol

episodes.synopsis: On the hunt for the best military items and collectables, Shooter comes across a Browning BAR rifle, first used in World War I.
episodes.title: Itchy Trigger Finger

episodes.synopsis: A pocket pistol like the one John Wilkes Booth used to assassinate President Lincoln brings in $2,400 at an auction in Galveston, Texas.
episodes.title: Assassin's Gun

episodes.synopsis: In Pasadena, Texas, Sean and the team find the Italian version of an M-14, which Shooter gets to test on the range.
episodes.title: Field of Screams

episodes.synopsis: In Cape Coral, Florida, Sean and Hammer meet a seller who grew up playing with what could be a Spanish helmet from the 16th century.
episodes.title: The Gun Sword

episodes.synopsis: The guys see a blunderbuss pistol from the American Revolution, a detailed Bowie knife and a 1907 Winchester, popular with 1920s gangsters.
episodes.title: Gangster's Choice

episodes.synopsis: The guys get off to a great start with an MP5 submachine gun that gets Shooter really excited, but the owner demands a high auction price.
episodes.title: Special Ops

episodes.synopsis: In Fort Myers, Florida, the guys are excited to come across a 1915 Vickers -- a rare machine gun.
episodes.title: Day of the Nighthawk

episodes.synopsis: The Lords of War see some great finds, including an anti-bandit gun, a pirate treasure chest and an Indian thrusting dagger.
episodes.title: Handheld Shotgun
